heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.9°C) and outside temperature (down 8.5°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 10.1°C), cloud levels (up 466 m), dew point temperature (up 8.0°C), and outside temperature (up 8.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 97.8m lower than yesterday, 12.0m higher than the past week, 466.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 841m minimum and 1909m maximum, with an average of 1362.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1350.8m and 1829.3m.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
